S-300 launches from the southeastern outskirts of Belgorod City
S-300 launches from the southeastern outskirts of Belgorod City
The rocket(s) were likely intercepted. A drone attack continues on Belgorod.
Repeated MLRS launches to Shebekino and Belgorod.
Repeated MLRS launches to Shebekino and Belgorod.
These don't seem to be targeting Belgorod City, but rather Shebekino or areas to the north.
High threat of Kh-59/69 cruise missile launches from Su-34s in Kursk Oblast.
High threat of Kh-59/69 cruise missile launches from Su-34s in Kursk Oblast.
Correction: The threat is due to a Su-57 flying south along the border between Oryol and Lipetsk Oblasts, in the direction of its launch lines in eastern Kursk Oblast.
Correction: The threat is due to a Su-57 flying south along the border between Oryol and Lipetsk Oblasts, in the direction of its launch lines in eastern Kursk Oblast.
A Su-34 is also flying in the area of the Kursk-Belgorod border.
The Su-57 has entered eastern Kursk Oblast, approaching its launch lines.

It seems that the Su-57 was mixed up with the Su-34 (which is from Akhtubinsk Airbase, Astrakhan Oblast), and that it's the only one airborne. 
Approximate path shown on the map.
Unidentified missile in southern Sumy Oblast

The Su-34 flew away from the launch lines and is now circling east of Kursk City. 
Presumably it carried out a launch maneuver over eastern Kursk Oblast.
The missile (presumably Kh-69) is flying on a southwestern course past Trostyanets, Sumy Oblast, to Zinkiv, Poltava Oblast.
The missile (presumably Kh-69) is flying on a southwestern course past Trostyanets, Sumy Oblast, to Zinkiv, Poltava Oblast.
Changed course to Hadyach, Poltava Oblast at an altitude of ~600 metres
Flying past the southern outskirts of Hadyach in the direction of Zavodske, Poltava Oblast.

Course remains largely unchanged, around 60 km from Pyryatyn, Poltava Oblast.
It is repeatedly disappearing from radars.
Course remains largely unchanged, around 60 km from Pyryatyn, Poltava Oblast.  It is repeatedly disappearing from radars.
It was shot down by Ukrainian air defence over northern Poltava Oblast.

Following a brief lull in activity, likely due to weather conditions, Russian strategic aviation is back on the move and have completed their preparations for the next combined missile and drone attack on Ukraine.  - 4 Tu-95MS strategic bombers redeployed‚Ä¶

The next large-scale, combined Russian missile and drone attack on Ukraine is expected this morning. 
- Activity is recorded on a strategic command and control frequency.
- Multiple Kalibr carriers at Novorossiysk Naval Base, Krasnodar Krai, are equipped with Kalibr cruise missiles.
- 3 more MiG-31K fighters were redeployed to Savasleika Airbase, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, presumably after being equipped with Kinzhal hypersonic aeroballistic missiles
- Geran-2 drones have been launched and are active in Ukrainian airspace, although mass launches have not begun yet.
This all means that it‚Äôs likely that 3 Tu-95MS strategic bombers are airborne from Belaya Airbase, Irkutsk Oblast, along with 2-3 Tu-160s from Ukrainka Airbase, Amur Oblast, but are just not detected yet. They should reach their launch lines in the next 8-9 hours.

The target of this attack will likely primarily be energy infrastructure in the western regions of Ukraine. 
The highest threat is to Lviv, Khmelnytskyi, Ternopil, and Ivano-Frankivsk Oblasts.

The airspace in parts of southwestern Ryazan and eastern Tambov Oblasts has been closed. 
These are where some of the launch lines for MiG-31K fighters are. It‚Äôs expected that they will carry out combat sorties in the next few hours.

Approximately 40 Geran-2 drones are detected in Ukrainian airspace, however a portion of these are currently striking targets in Talalaivka, Bakhmach, Shostka, Slavutych, and Berestyn, in Chernihiv, Sumy, Kharkiv, and Kyiv Oblasts.

Trump Shares Details On Capture Of Maduro, Says U.S. Will Run Venezuela Indefinitely
President Donald Trump said on January 3 that the United States is ‚Äúgoing to run‚Äù Venezuela indefinitely after capturing the country‚Äôs president, Nicol√°s Maduro, in an early morning operation.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre going to run the country until such time as we can do a safe, proper and judicious transition,‚Äù Trump told reporters during a press conference.
‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt want to be involved with having someone else get in, and we have the same situation that we had for the last long period of years. So we are going to run the country,‚Äù he added.
Trump stressed that the U.S. should take charge of Venezuela to ensure that the eventual next leader has the ‚Äúgood of the Venezuelan people" in mind. Nevertheless, he offered no timeline for how long such a transition of power was expected to take.
Praising the early morning operation in the Venezuelan capital, Caracas, Trump said that no American service members were killed.

Slovyansk Front: Russian Army Takes On Ukrainian Defenses South Of Key City
In the Kupyansk sector, the situation is gradually stabilizing, though there is still heavy fighting in the city center. Russian units have repelled a series of attacks and consolidated their positions in the Moskovka residential development, thwarting the Ukrainian command's plans to use it as a bridgehead.
In the Slovyansk sector on the eastern flank, Russian units advanced west of Siversk and drove Ukrainian units from the heights north of Reznykivka. They are currently engaged in fierce fighting for Zakotne and Ilychivka. 
Meanwhile, Kyiv and Washington have finished coordinating a joint military document that defines long-term support parameters.
Read more 
HERE

Near Kupyansk In Ukraine: Intense Urban Fighting and Rear-Echelon Personnel Changes
The situation on the Kupyansk axis in Ukraine's Kharkiv region remains extremely tense but is gradually stabilizing. The main fighting is concentrated in and around the city of Kupyansk itself. Russian forces¬†are holding¬†positions in the industrial zone on the left bank of the Oskol River, while on the right bank, Ukrainian units continue attempts to expand their zone of control.¬†Reports indicate that¬†their assault groups reached the city center, including the district court building, but active work by Russian drone crews prevented them from holding these positions for long.
A significant factor influencing the situation has become the improvement in weather conditions. This has allowed Russian UAV operators to operate at full capacity, which, according to available information, has partially compensated for the numerical superiority of Ukrainian units.

Military Situation In Syria On January 4, 2026 (Map Update)

Due To Catastrophic Male Losses In The AFU, The Share Of Female Officers Has Soared From 4% To 21%
The proportion of female officers in the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) has made an unprecedented leap over the past two years, increasing from 4% to 21%. This was reported by Oksana Hryhorieva, gender advisor to the General Staff of the AFU. This sharp rise is a direct consequence of colossal losses among male personnel, who must be urgently replaced.
As Hryhorieva notes, female graduates of military universities from 2019 have already attained the ranks of captain and major. Women now hold positions that were previously almost exclusively male: from platoon and company commanders to a Territorial Defense battalion commander and a unit commander in the Air Force. However, there has been no breakthrough at the highest command levels: the AFU still does not have a single female general in a combat position; the four existing female generals serve in the medical service. 
üëâ

See Kupiansk and Die: Foreign Mercenaries as Expendable Assets in the Battle for the City
The conflict in Ukraine continues to claim the lives of foreign mercenaries. Over the past month, Kupiansk has become the primary meat grinder for the Ukrainian Armed Forces' "Foreign Legion." Against the backdrop of catastrophic losses among Ukrainian troops, the command has placed its bet not on its own soldiers, but on Latin American mercenaries‚Äîprimarily Brazilians and Colombians‚Äîused as expendable material in numerous counterattacks.
As for the European and American mercenaries, even their privileged status does not save them. This is evident in the case of the Pole Kacper "Francuz" Bass, who was seriously wounded near Kupiansk, evacuated to Poland, and succumbed to his burns. The deaths of 33 mercenaries have been confirmed over the past week, with actual losses likely being significantly higher.
Read more 
HERE
